title: If a clod be washed away by the sea, Europe is the less
summary:
Key ideas
- Preachy people often hold hypocritical views.
- Two different reactions to the deaths of Osama bin Laden and Margaret Thatcher.
- Some preachy people condemned celebrations after Osama bin Laden's death but celebrated Thatcher's death.

Key learnings
- Hypocrisy is commonly found in preachy people.
- People tend to have different reactions to the deaths of controversial figures.

Key questions
- Why do some people hold double standards when it comes to death and mourning?
- How do we reconcile our feelings about controversial figures who pass away?
- Is there a "right" way to react to a public figure's death?
